item.title: What is wrong with my code
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

devenb123:

Please tell me how to fix mine… I don’t want your edited one…

You declared your variables inside your methods, which means that they can’t be accessed outside of their respective methods. To fix this, move them outside of your methods. Literally.

Read full topic

item.title: What is wrong with my code
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:8, topic:451273”]This could be quite amusing

[code=java]import java.util.*;

public class Name {

private static int height, weight, age;
static final Random r = new Random();
static Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
static String[] descriptiveWords = {
	"Faggot", "Dipshit", "Fuckhole", "Dickhead", "Jerk", "Unknown"
};

public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("Let's start the game :P");
	startGame();
}

public static int getHeight() {
    return height;
}
public static int getAge() {
	return age;
}
public static int getWeight() {
	return weight;
}

public static void startGame() {
	System.out.println("What is your height (In feet)?");
    height = input.nextInt();
    System.out.println("" +
		(getHeight() <= 3 ? "Oh shit, your a midget!" : 
		 getHeight() >= 7 ? "Fuck, your tall!" : 
		 "Well, I guess your adverage.")
	);
	
	System.out.println("\nWhat is your weight?");
    weight = input.nextInt();
    System.out.println("" + 
		(getWeight() >= 150 ? "*COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*" : "*COUGH* Toothpick *COUGH*")
	);
	
	System.out.println("\nWhat is your age?");
    age = input.nextInt();
    System.out.println(
		"Okay, So let me get this straight, you're " + getHeight() + 
		" feet tall, " + getWeight() + " pounds, and " + getAge() + " years old..."
	);
	System.out.println("Calculating Information...");
	System.out.println("Your a " + descriptiveWords[r.nextInt(descriptiveWords.length - 1)]);
}

}[/code][/quote]the fuck

Read full topic

item.title: What is wrong with my code
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

This could be quite amusing

[code=java]import java.util.*;

public class Name {

private static int height, weight, age;
static final Random r = new Random();
static Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
static String[] descriptiveWords = {
	"Faggot", "Dipshit", "Fuckhole", "Dickhead", "Jerk", "Unknown"
};

public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("Let's start the game :P");
	startGame();
}

public static int getHeight() {
    return height;
}
public static int getAge() {
	return age;
}
public static int getWeight() {
	return weight;
}

public static void startGame() {
	System.out.println("What is your height (In feet)?");
    height = input.nextInt();
    System.out.println("" +
		(getHeight() <= 3 ? "Oh shit, your a midget!" : 
		 getHeight() >= 7 ? "Fuck, your tall!" : 
		 "Well, I guess your adverage.")
	);
	
	System.out.println("\nWhat is your weight?");
    weight = input.nextInt();
    System.out.println("" + 
		(getWeight() >= 150 ? "*COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*" : "*COUGH* Toothpick *COUGH*")
	);
	
	System.out.println("\nWhat is your age?");
    age = input.nextInt();
    System.out.println(
		"Okay, So let me get this straight, you're " + getHeight() + 
		" feet tall, " + getWeight() + " pounds, and " + getAge() + " years old..."
	);
	System.out.println("Calculating Information...");
	System.out.println("Your a " + descriptiveWords[r.nextInt(descriptiveWords.length - 1)]);
}

}[/code]

item.title: What is wrong with my code
item.dc:creator: @devenb123 devenb123
item.description:
@devenb123 wrote:

What’s wrong with this code…?

import java.util.*; public class Name { public static void main (String[] args){ System.out.println("Let's start the game :P"); height(); weight(); age(); } public static void height() { System.out.println("What is your height?"); Scanner heigh = new Scanner(System.in); int height = heigh.nextInt(); System.out.println("Oh shit, You're a midget! " + height + "Feet, LOL big people, your world."); } public static void weight(){ System.out.println("What is your weight ?"); Scanner weigher = new Scanner(System.in); int weight = weigher.nextInt(); System.out.println("Okay Mr. " + weight + " Pounds, *COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*"); } public static void age() { System.out.println("Hey fag, please tell me your age."); Scanner ager = new Scanner(System.in); int age = ager.nextInt(); System.out.println("Okay, So let me get this straight, you're " + height + "feet tall," + weight + "pounds, and " + age + " years old...."); System.out.println("Calculating Information..."); System.out.println("You're a: Faggot."); } }
